lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny dreamt of a mountain.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Jagged and lonesome, it dwarfed other peaks of the mountain chain, cutting the night sky with its sharp edges. A radiant moon bathed its slopes in the ghostly, pale light.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: On one of the slopes, the remnants of an old road stubbornly clung to the rocks. Here and there, weathered paved stones could be seen through the snow. To the right side of the road, a sheer cliff face rose as an impregnable wall. To the left, a silent black sea of nothingness indicated an endless fall. Strong winds crashed into the mountain over and over again, screaming in powerless rage.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, the moon fell over the horizon. The sun rose from the west, streaked across the sky and disappeared in the east. Snowflakes jumped from the ground and returned into the embrace of clouds. Sunny realized that he was seeing the flow of time in reverse.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: In an instant, hundreds of years flew by. The snow retreated, baring the old road. Cold shivers ran down Sunny's back as he noticed human bones littering the ground. A moment later, the bones were gone, and in their place, a slave caravan appeared, moving backwards down the mountain in the clamor of chains.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Time slowed, stopped, and then resumed its usual pace.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: [Aspirant! Welcome to the Nightmare Spell. Prepare for your First Trial…]

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'What… what the hell is this?'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Step. Step. Another step.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: A dull ache was radiating through Sunny's bleeding feet as he was shivering from cold. His threadbare tunic was nearly useless against the biting wind. His wrists were the main source of agony: badly hurt by the iron shackles, they sent a sharp pang of pain every time the freezing metal touched his broken skin.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'What kind of a situation is this?!'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny looked up and down, noticing a long chain winding up the road, with dozens and dozens of hollow-eyed people — slaves just like him — shackled to it at small intervals. Ahead of him, a man with broad shoulders and a bloodied back was walking with a measured gait. Behind him, a shifty-looking guy with quick, desperate eyes was quietly cursing under his breath in a language that Sunny did not know, but somehow still understood. From time to time, armed horsemen in ancient-style armor would pass by, giving the slaves menacing looks.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: However you judged it, things were really bad.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny was more bewildered than panicked. True, these circumstances were not like what the First Nightmares were supposed to be. Usually, freshly chosen aspirants would find themselves in a scenario that presented them with a fair amount of agency: they would become members of privileged or warrior castes, with plenty of access to necessary weapons to at least try to tackle any conflict.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Starting out as a powerless slave, shackled and already half-dead, was as far from being ideal as one could imagine.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: However, the Spell was as much about challenge as it was about balance. As the old policeman said, it created trials, not executions. So Sunny was pretty sure that, to counter this abysmal start, it would reward him with something good. A powerful Aspect, at least.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'Let's see… how do I do this?'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Remembering popular webtoons he read as a child, Sunny concentrated and thought about words like "status", "myself" and "information". Indeed, as soon as he focused, shimmering runes appeared in the air in front of him. Once again, although he did not know this ancient alphabet, the meaning behind it was somehow clear.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: He quickly found the rune describing his Aspect… and, finally, lost his composure.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'What?! What the actual fuck?!'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Name: Sunless.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: True Name: —

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Rank: Aspirant.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Soul Core: Dormant.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Memories: —

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Echoes: —

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Attributes: [Fated], [Mark of Divinity], [Child of Shadows].

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Aspect: [Temple Slave].

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Aspect Description: [Slave is a useless wretch with no skills or abilities worth a mention. A temple slave is just the same, except much rarer.]

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Speechless, Sunny stared at the runes, trying to convince himself that he was maybe just seeing things. Surely, he couldn't be that unlucky… right?

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'No useless Aspects my ass!'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: As soon as this thought appeared in his mind, he lost the rhythm of his steps and stumbled, pulling the chain down with his weight. Immediately, the shifty guy behind him screamed:

lines.speaker: Shifty Guy
lines.text: "Whore's bastard! Watch where you're going!"

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny hurriedly dismissed the runes, which were only visible to him, and tried to recover his balance. A moment later, he was once again walking steadily — however, not before inadvertently pulling on the chain one more time.

lines.speaker: Shifty Guy
lines.text: "You little shit! I'm going to kill you!"

lines.speaker: Broad-Shouldered Man
lines.text: "Why bother? The weakling will be dead by sunrise anyway. The mountain will kill him."

lines.speaker: Broad-Shouldered Man
lines.text: "It'll kill you and me, too. Just a bit later. I really don't know what the Imperials are thinking, forcing us into this cold."

lines.speaker: Shifty Guy
lines.text: "Speak for yourself, fool! I'm planning to survive!"

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny silently shook his head and concentrated on not falling again.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'What a charming pair.'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, a third voice joined the conversation from somewhere further back. This one sounded gentle and intelligent.

lines.speaker: Gentle-Voiced Slave
lines.text: "This mountain pass is usually much warmer this time of year. We just had really bad luck. Also, I would advise you against harming this boy."

lines.speaker: Broad-Shouldered Man
lines.text: "Why is that?"

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Sunny turned his head slightly, listening.

lines.speaker: Gentle-Voiced Slave
lines.text: "Haven't you seen the markings on his skin? He is not like us, who fell into slavery due to debts, crimes or misfortune. He was born a slave. A temple slave, to be precise. Not long ago, the Imperials destroyed the last temple of the Shadow God. I suspect that this is how the boy ended up here."

lines.speaker: Broad-Shouldered Man
lines.text: "So what? Why should we be afraid of a half-forgotten, weakling god? He couldn't even save his own temples."

lines.speaker: Gentle-Voiced Slave
lines.text: "The Empire is protected by the mighty War God. Of course they're not afraid to burn down a few temples. But we here are not protected by anything or anyone. Do you really want to risk angering a god?"

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The broad-shouldered man grunted, not willing to answer.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Their conversation was stopped by a young soldier riding a beautiful, white horse. Clad in a simple leather cuirass, armed with a spear and a short sword, he looked dignified and noble. To Sunny's irritation, the asshole was really pretty, too. If this was a historical drama, the soldier would definitely be a male lead.

lines.speaker: Young Soldier
lines.text: "What is going on here?"

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: There was no particular menace in his voice, even something resembling concern.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: When everyone hesitated, the gentle-voiced slave answered:

lines.speaker: Gentle-Voiced Slave
lines.text: "It's nothing, sir. We are just all tired and cold. Especially our young friend over there. This journey is truly too hard for someone that young."

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The soldier looked at Sunny with pity.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'What are you looking at? You're not much older than me!' Sunny thought.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Of course, he didn't say anything out loud.

lines.speaker: Young Soldier
lines.text: "Bear with it a little more, child. We will stop for the night soon. For now, here, drink some water."

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'Child? Child?!'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Due to his thin body and small stature, both caused by malnourishment, Sunny was often mistaken for someone younger. Usually, he didn't hesitate to use it to his advantage, but now, for some reason, being called a child really irked him.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Still, he was really thirsty.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: He was just about to take the flask when a whip cracked in the air, and suddenly Sunny was in a world of pain. He stumbled, once again pulling on the chain and causing the shifty slave behind him to curse.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Another soldier, this one older and angrier, stopped his horse a few steps back. The whip that sliced the back of Sunny's tunic open and drew blood belonged to him. Without even glancing at the slaves, the older soldier pierced his younger colleague with a disdainful glare.

lines.speaker: Older Soldier
lines.text: "What do you think you're doing?"

lines.speaker: Young Soldier
lines.text: "I was just giving this boy some water."

lines.speaker: Older Soldier
lines.text: "He'll receive water with the rest of them once we camp!"

lines.speaker: Young Soldier
lines.text: "But…"

lines.speaker: Older Soldier
lines.text: "Shut your mouth! These slaves are not your friends. Understood? They're not even people. Treat them like people and they'll begin imagining things."

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The young soldier looked at Sunny, then lowered his head and put the flask back on his belt.

lines.speaker: Older Soldier
lines.text: "Don't let me catch you making friends with slaves again, newbie. Or next time it will be your back tasting my whip!"

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: As if to illustrate his intention, the older soldier cracked his whip in the air and rode past them, radiating threat and anger. Sunny watched him go with well-concealed malice.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'I don't know how, but I will watch you die first.'

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Then he turned his head and glanced in the direction of the younger soldier, who was falling behind with his head still lowered.

lines.speaker: Sunny
lines.text: 'And you, second.'
